meanings.definition: A large number of insects or other small organisms moving together in a group.
meanings.sent1: The swarms of bees buzzed around the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The park was filled with swarms of mosquitoes during the summer.
meanings.sent3: The swarms of ants decided to have a picnic on the picnic blanket.
meanings.sent4: The swarms of fireflies lit up the night sky like tiny lanterns.
meanings.sent5: The swarms of butterflies painted the garden in a rainbow of colors.

meanings.definition: A large group of people or things, especially when in motion.
meanings.sent1: The swarms of shoppers rushed into the store during the sale.
meanings.sent2: The swarms of birds flew south for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The swarms of books on the shelf seemed to be having a book club meeting.
meanings.sent4: The swarms of cars on the highway resembled a colorful river flowing.
meanings.sent5: The swarms of students filled the school hallway with chatter and laughter.
